@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The grid layout manager arranges the items in a two dimensional grid. Widgets can be placed into the grid's cells and may span multiple rows and columns. Features

  • Flex values for rows and columns
  • Minimal and maximal column and row sizes
  • Manually setting of column and row sizes
  • Horizontal and vertical alignment
  • Horizontal and vertical spacing
  • Column and row spans

  • Auto-sizing Item Properties

  • row (Integer): The row of the cell the widget should occupy. Each cell can only containing one widget. This layout property is mandatory.
  • column (Integer): The column of the cell the widget should occupy. Each cell can only containing one widget. This layout property is mandatory.
  • rowSpan (Integer): The number of rows, the widget should span, starting from the row specified in the row property. The cells in the spanned rows must be empty as well.
  • colSpan (Integer): The number of columns, the widget should span, starting from the column specified in the column property. The cells in the spanned columns must be empty as well.

Example Here is a little example of how to use the grid layout. 

 var layout = new qx.ui.layout.Grid();
 layout.setRowFlex(0, 1);
 layout.setColumnWidth(1, 200);
 var container = new qx.ui.container.Composite(layout);
 container.add(new qx.ui.core.Widget(), {row: 0, column: 0});
 container.add(new qx.ui.core.Widget(), {row: 0, column: 1});
 container.add(new qx.ui.core.Widget(), {row: 1, column: 0, rowSpan: 2});

External Documentation Extended documentation and links to demos of this layout in the qooxdoo manual.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
spacingX {Integer?0} The horizontal spacing between grid cells.
     Sets {@link #spacingX}.
@param.description:
The horizontal spacing between grid cells.
     Sets {@link #spacingX}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
spacingY {Integer?0} The vertical spacing between grid cells.
     Sets {@link #spacingY}.
@param.description:
The vertical spacing between grid cells.
     Sets {@link #spacingY}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The horizontal spacing between grid cells.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The vertical spacing between grid cells.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Allow growing of spanning cells' widths beyond the accumulated widths of the columns. The default behavior (init value false) is that the width of the spanning cell is determined by the accumulated width of the columns (plus spacing). Setting this property to true lets the cell width grow as needed to show the widget in the spanning cell, which also enlarges the width of the spanned columns.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The owning object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: {String} The ID of the object.

@description.body: Rebuild the internal representation of the grid

@description.body: Shortcut to set both horizontal and vertical spacing between grid cells to the same value.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: spacing {Integer} new horizontal and vertical spacing

@return.name: @return
@return.description: This object (for chaining support).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the default cell alignment for a column. This alignment can be overridden on a per cell basis by setting the cell's content widget's alignX and alignY properties. If on a grid cell both row and a column alignment is set, the horizontal alignment is taken from the column and the vertical alignment is taken from the row.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: column {Integer} Column index

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
hAlign {String} The horizontal alignment. Valid values are
    "left", "center" and "right".
@param.description:
The horizontal alignment. Valid values are
    "left", "center" and "right".

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
vAlign {String} The vertical alignment. Valid values are
    "top", "middle", "bottom"
@param.description:
The vertical alignment. Valid values are
    "top", "middle", "bottom"

@return.name: @return
@return.description: This object (for chaining support)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get a map of the column's alignment.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: column {Integer} The column index

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} A map with the keys vAlign and hAlign containing the vertical and horizontal column alignment.
@return.description: A map with the keys vAlign and hAlign containing the vertical and horizontal column alignment.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the default cell alignment for a row. This alignment can be overridden on a per cell basis by setting the cell's content widget's alignX and alignY properties. If on a grid cell both row and a column alignment is set, the horizontal alignment is taken from the column and the vertical alignment is taken from the row.

@param.body:

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get a map of the cell's alignment. For vertical alignment the row alignment takes precedence over the column alignment. For horizontal alignment it is the over way round. If an alignment is set on the cell widget using {@link qx.ui.core.LayoutItem#setLayoutProperties}, this alignment takes always precedence over row or column alignment.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: row {Integer} The cell's row index

@param.name: @param
@param.body: column {Integer} The cell's column index

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} A map with the keys vAlign and hAlign containing the vertical and horizontal cell alignment.
@return.description: A map with the keys vAlign and hAlign containing the vertical and horizontal cell alignment.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Computes the widget's size hint including the widget's margins

@param.name: @param
@param.body: widget {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} The widget to get the size for
@param.description: The widget to get the size for

@return.name: @return
@return.description: a size hint map

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Check whether all row spans fit with their preferred height into the preferred row heights. If there is not enough space, the preferred row sizes are increased. The distribution respects the flex and max values of the rows. The same is true for the min sizes. The height array is modified in place.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
rowHeights {Map[]} The current row height array as computed by
     {@link #_getRowHeights}.
@param.description:
The current row height array as computed by
     {@link #_getRowHeights}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Check whether all col spans fit with their preferred width into the preferred column widths. If there is not enough space the preferred column sizes are increased. The distribution respects the flex and max values of the columns. The same is true for the min sizes. The width array is modified in place.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
colWidths {Map[]} The current column width array as computed by
     {@link #_getColWidths}.
@param.description:
The current column width array as computed by
     {@link #_getColWidths}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Compute the min/pref/max row heights.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map[]} An array containing height information for each row. The entries have the keys minHeight, maxHeight and height.
@return.description: An array containing height information for each row. The entries have the keys minHeight, maxHeight and height.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Compute the min/pref/max column widths.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map[]} An array containing width information for each column. The entries have the keys minWidth, maxWidth and width.
@return.description: An array containing width information for each column. The entries have the keys minWidth, maxWidth and width.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Computes for each column by how many pixels it must grow or shrink, taking the column flex values and min/max widths into account.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: width {Integer} The grid width

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Integer[]} Sparse array of offsets to add to each column width. If
     an array entry is empty nothing should be added to the column.
@return.description:
Sparse array of offsets to add to each column width. If
     an array entry is empty nothing should be added to the column.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Computes for each row by how many pixels it must grow or shrink, taking the row flex values and min/max heights into account.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: height {Integer} The grid height

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Integer[]} Sparse array of offsets to add to each row height. If
     an array entry is empty nothing should be added to the row.
@return.description:
Sparse array of offsets to add to each row height. If
     an array entry is empty nothing should be added to the row.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the internal private __colSpans array in order have a protected getter which can be used other methods to make them overridable

@return.name: @return
@return.description: the __colSpans array

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The bind method delegates the call to the {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} function. As source, the current object (this) will be used.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
sourcePropertyChain {String} The property chain which represents
   the source property.
@param.description:
The property chain which represents
   the source property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
targetObject {qx.core.Object} The object which the source should
   be bind to.
@param.description:
The object which the source should
   be bind to.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: targetProperty {String} The property name of the target object.
@param.description: The property name of the target object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
options {Map?null} A map containing the options. See
   {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
   information.
@param.description:
A map containing the options. See
   {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
   information.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{var} Returns the internal id for that binding. This can be used
   for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not an atomic
   id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.
@return.description:
Returns the internal id for that binding. This can be used
   for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not an atomic
   id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{qx.core.AssertionError} If the event is no data event or
   there is no property definition for object and property (source and
   target).
@throws.description:
If the event is no data event or
   there is no property definition for object and property (source and
   target).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The bind method delegates the call to the {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} function. As source, the current object (this) will be used.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
sourcePropertyChain {String} The property chain which represents
   the source property.
@param.description:
The property chain which represents
   the source property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
targetObject {qx.core.Object} The object which the source should
   be bind to.
@param.description:
The object which the source should
   be bind to.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: targetProperty {String} The property name of the target object.
@param.description: The property name of the target object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
options {Map} A map containing the options. See
   {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
   information.
@param.description:
A map containing the options. See
   {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
   information.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.Promise} A promise which is resolved when the initial value
 	 has been set on the target.  Note that this does NOT resolve when subsequent
   values are returned.  The promise value is the internal id for that binding.
   The id can be used for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not
   an atomic id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.
@return.description:
A promise which is resolved when the initial value
 	 has been set on the target.  Note that this does NOT resolve when subsequent
   values are returned.  The promise value is the internal id for that binding.
   The id can be used for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not
   an atomic id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{qx.core.AssertionError} If the event is no data event or
   there is no property definition for object and property (source and
   target).
@throws.description:
If the event is no data event or
   there is no property definition for object and property (source and
   target).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes the binding with the given id from the current object. The id has to be the id returned by any of the bind functions.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {var} The id of the binding.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If the binding could not be found.
@throws.description: If the binding could not be found.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes all bindings between the object and the related one.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
relatedObject {qx.core.Object} The object of which related
   bindings should be removed.
@param.description:
The object of which related
   bindings should be removed.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{Error} If one of the bindings listed internally can not be
   removed.
@throws.description:
If one of the bindings listed internally can not be
   removed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes all bindings from the object.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{qx.core.AssertionError} If the object is not in the internal
   registry of the bindings.
@throws.description:
If the object is not in the internal
   registry of the bindings.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{Error} If one of the bindings listed internally can not be
   removed.
@throws.description:
If one of the bindings listed internally can not be
   removed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an array which lists all bindings for the object.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Array} An array of binding informations. Every binding
   information is an array itself containing id, sourceObject, sourceEvent,
   targetObject and targetProperty in that order.
@return.description:
An array of binding informations. Every binding
   information is an array itself containing id, sourceObject, sourceEvent,
   targetObject and targetProperty in that order.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add event listener to this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
self {Object ? null} Reference to the 'this' variable inside
         the event listener. When not given, the corresponding dispatcher
         usually falls back to a default, which is the target
         by convention. Note this is not a strict requirement, i.e.
         custom dispatchers can follow a different strategy.
@param.description:
Reference to the 'this' variable inside
         the event listener. When not given, the corresponding dispatcher
         usually falls back to a default, which is the target
         by convention. Note this is not a strict requirement, i.e.
         custom dispatchers can follow a different strategy.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.
@param.description:
Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{String} An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.
@return.description:
An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.

@description.name: @description

@param.name: @param

@param.name: @param

@param.description: reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.
@param.description:
Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{String} An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.
@return.description:
An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes an event listener from an event target by an id returned by {@link #addListener}

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String} The id returned by {@link #addListener}

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)
@return.description: Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Check if there are one or more listeners for an event type.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to check for listeners of
         the bubbling or of the capturing phase.
@param.description:
Whether to check for listeners of
         the bubbling or of the capturing phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the object has a listener of the given type.
@return.description: Whether the object has a listener of the given type.

@description.name: @description

@param.name: @param
@param.body: evt {qx.event.type.Event} event to dispatch

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

Arguments, which will be passed to

{Boolean|qx.Promise} whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and dispatches an event on this object; equivalent to fireEvent, except that it always returns a promise

       the event's init method.

Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.

{qx.Promise} a promise aggregated from the event handlers;
  if the default was prevented, the promise is rejected

a promise aggregated from the event handlers;

@description.name: @description

Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.

{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Create an event object and dispatch it on this object; equivalent to fireNonBubblingEvent, except that it always returns a promise. The event dispatched with this method does never bubble! Use only if you are sure that bubbling is not required.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Class?qx.event.type.Event} The event class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
args {Array?null} Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.
@param.description:
Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.Promise} a promise aggregated from the event handlers;
  if the default was prevented, the promise is rejected
@return.description:
a promise aggregated from the event handlers;
  if the default was prevented, the promise is rejected

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and dispatches an non-bubbling data event on this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {var} User defined data attached to the event object
@param.description: User defined data attached to the event object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: oldData {var?null} The event's old data (optional)

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
cancelable {Boolean?false} Whether or not an event can have its default
     action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
     default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
     right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
     the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
     {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}
@param.description:
Whether or not an event can have its default
     action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
     default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
     right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
     the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
     {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean|qx.Promise} whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description

     right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
     the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling

Whether or not an event can have its default

     right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets multiple properties at once by using a property list or sets one property and its value by the first and second argument. As a fallback, if no generated property setter could be found, a handwritten setter will be searched and invoked if available.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {Map | String} a map of property values. The key is the name of the property.
@param.description: a map of property values. The key is the name of the property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {var?} the value, only used when data is a string.
@param.description: the value, only used when data is a string.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Object} Returns this instance if data is a map or a non-generated setter is called; otherwise returns value.
@return.description: Returns this instance if data is a map or a non-generated setter is called; otherwise returns value.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist
@throws.description: if a property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the value of the given property. If no generated getter could be found, a fallback tries to access a handwritten getter.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: prop {String} Name of the property.

@return.name: @return
@return.description: The value of the value

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist
@throws.description: if a property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the value of the given property. If no generated resetter could be found, a handwritten resetter will be invoked, if available.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: prop {String} Name of the property.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist
@throws.description: if a property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the property is initialized, i.e. has a defined init value or has got a value by a setter method.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: prop {String} Name of the property

@return.name: @return
@return.description: If the property is initialized

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If the property defined does not exist
@throws.description: If the property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Apply owner

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Apply objectId

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Called when a child's objectId changes

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Reflect changes to IDs or owners

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the object with the specified ID

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
id
          {String} ID of the object

@return.name: @return
@return.description: the found object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates the object and adds it to a list; most classes are expected to override _createQxObjectImpl NOT this method.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String} ID of the object

@return.name: @return
@return.description: the created object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates the object, intended to be overridden. Null is a valid return value and will be cached by getQxObject, however undefined is NOT a valid value and so will not be cached meaning that _createQxObjectImpl will be called multiple times until a valid value is returned.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String} ID of the object

@return.name: @return
@return.description: the created object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds an object as owned by this object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: obj {qx.core.Object} the object to register

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String?} the id to set when registering the object
@param.description: the id to set when registering the object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Discards an object from the list of owned objects; note that this does not dispose of the object, simply forgets it if it exists.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: args {String|Object} the ID of the object to discard, or the object itself
@param.description: the ID of the object to discard, or the object itself

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes an owned object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: obj {qx.core.Object} the object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an array of objects that are owned by this object, or an empty array if none exists.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxOwner. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxObjectId. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property spacingX. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #spacingX}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property spacingX. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #spacingX}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property spacingX. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #spacingX}.
